TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TagPrefixCollection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TagPrefixInfo> class allows you to programmatically access and modify tag-prefix information stored in a configuration file. Tag prefixes associate a "namespace" in ASP.NET with the assemblies and namespaces that must be included for custom controls and user controls to work properly.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.TagPrefixInfo> objects are stored as members of a TagPrefixCollection object. The TagPrefixCollection class allows you to programmatically access and modify the `controls` subsection of the `pages` section of a configuration file.
## Examples The following configuration file excerpt shows how to declaratively specify values for several properties of the TagPrefixCollection type.
``` <system.web> <pages> <controls> <clear /> <remove tagPrefix="MyTags" /> <!â€”- Searches all linked assemblies for the namespace --> <add tagPrefix="MyTags1" namespace=" MyNameSpace "/> <!-- Uses a specified assembly --> <add tagPrefix="MyTags2" namespace="MyNameSpace" assembly="MyAssembly"/> <!-- Uses the specified source for the user control --> <add tagprefix="MyTags3" tagname="MyCtrl" src="MyControl.ascx"/> </controls> </pages> </system.web> ```
The following code example shows how to use the TagPrefixCollection class to programmatically modify tag-prefix settings. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection#12](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_83_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection#12](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_83_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The TagPrefixCollection constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection.Controls%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection> class always contains an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TagPrefixCollection> type. Use this instance, rather than creating your own.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Web.Configuration.TagPrefixInfo tagPrefixInformation) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a object to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collection must not already contain a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TagPrefixInfo> object with the same property values. If it does, a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationException> will be thrown.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Add method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection#32](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/339d8e66-3651-4609-af81-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection#32](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/339d8e66-3651-4609-af81-_1.vb)]

Docs.exception:
The object to add already exists in the collection.
\- or -
The collection is read-only.

public System.Web.Configuration.TagPrefixInfo this[int index] { get; set; }

Docs.param: The index of a object in the collection.

Docs.value: The object at the specified index, or if there is no object at that index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property overwrites the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TagPrefixInfo> object if it already exists at the specified index; otherwise, a new object is created and added to the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.TagMapCollection.Item%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.PagesSection> class.
